formattedAddress: 865 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 865 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10021-4103, USA

originalText.text:
St. James Church on Madison Avenue is a true marvel, blending rich history and magnificent architecture in the heart of New York City.

This splendid church, nestled on Madison Avenue, boasts a history that spans generations. Established in [year of founding], it has witnessed the evolution of our city and our nation. Walking through its doors is like stepping back in time, as you're enveloped by the echoes of centuries past.

The architecture of St. James Church is nothing short of awe-inspiring. Its Gothic Revival design, featuring towering spires, intricate stained glass windows, and ornate stonework, is a testament to the craftsmanship of a bygone era. Every arch and detail tells a story, and each visit unveils new facets of its architectural splendor.

The stained glass windows, in particular, are a sight to behold. They depict biblical scenes and saints in vivid colors, casting a kaleidoscope of light and color within the sanctuary. It's a visual symphony that adds to the spiritual experience.

What makes St. James Church truly special is its commitment to preserving its historical and architectural legacy. The church has been designated as a New York City Landmark and listed on the National Register of Historic Places, ensuring that future generations can continue to appreciate its beauty and significance.

Visiting St. James Church is not just a spiritual journey; it's a voyage through time and artistry. Whether you're a history enthusiast, an architecture buff, or simply seeking a moment of reflection in a place of timeless beauty, this church is an absolute must-visit. It's a living testament to the rich heritage of New York City and a sanctuary where history and architecture converge in harmonious splendor.

originalText.text: I'm not going back to this church ever again because they kicked me out of a weekly meeting for being too young and not over 50 years old. The entire room of very old women and men sat there while the person in charge refused me to enter because I was too young at age 37.  Churches will die if they continue to treat others like this.  I pray it is a place of peace for everyone who is allowed in and may the people of this church  learn from their actions and welcome everyone of all ages. Jesus doesn't discriminate and He welcomes everyone in prayer.

originalText.text: The interior of the church is beautiful and serene.  The  staff is nice.  I  found out that twice a week that they provide warm meals for individuals. This is wonderful that they provide this service.

originalText.text:
865 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10021

St James church

Search for the background of this antique thing, I got basic ideas like this

The Episcopal Church (TEC) is the United States-based member church of the worldwide Anglican Communion. It is a Christian church divided into nine provinces and has dioceses in the United States, Taiwan, Micronesia, the Caribbean, Central and South America, as well as the Convocation of Episcopal Churches in Europe and the Navajoland Area Mission. The current presiding bishop of the Episcopal Church is Michael Bruce Curry, the first African American bishop to serve in that position.

originalText.text: Stunning architecture. Friendly, serious love, Desmond Tutu attended when he visited NY. Gossip Girl was filmed here many times when in the early days. If you should visit the church make sure you go across the street to Georgio Armani and have a cappuccino on the corner they have a beautiful scene there. And do some shopping. Good luck. And look up always look up when you’re in New York there’s a lot of gyms up there
